title: Since we are all answer seekers, and question askers here, what would you say most fuels your curiosity - are you innately curious or does something else drive you? - Quora

response.answer_text: I consider myself among the most curious of anyone I’ve met ... perhaps even a voracious curiosity. That can come across as nosy, or even creepy. I’ve learned to ask certain questions when my wife is present. My contrarian observation is that I observe many of the most prolific Quora members rarely ask Questions. They might have 10,000 Answers and zero questions. I ponder if that suggests a lack of curiosity on their part and/or a reluctance to expose ignorance. I try to have the attitude of … Ignorance can be fixed … stupid is foreverI learn more when I am wrong than when I am correct.A wise man seeks wise counsel … and is intentional to reduce “pride of authorship”

Since we are all answer seekers, and question askers here, what would you say most fuels your curiosity - are you innately curious or does something else drive you? I'm on Quora merely to fuel my curiosity for anything out of the ordinary on almost any topic (science, wildlife, astronomy, sport, and religion). So I guess I'm innately curious. I don't ask questions though, I just browse through. I do answer questions, but only in selected topics that I am well read in. Of course, when I see an A2A or a question or answer that seek to misrepresent Islam, I'm compelled to answer, but mostly I'm just here to learn new things every day.
